review.title: “Fantastic place to learn Real Estate Investment ropes”
review.pros: Pros – - World class Work/Life balance- Extremely nice people to work with- Easy to learn the position
review.cons: Cons – - Limited growth opportunity- Position not engaging enough-
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be careful not to expand the workforce faster than the increase in department workload merits.

review.title: “A place to start to learn about commercial real estate finance.”
review.pros: Pros – Asset managers are encouraged to work with analysts and associates to help them gain exposure to higher-level responsibilities.
review.cons: Cons – Limited room for professional growth unless you manage to get a transfer to another division. Most of the work involved in primary servicing seem to revolve around Fannie Mae / Freddie Mac pre-securitized (warehouse) assets so your experience will be almost entirely on multifamily assets. If you are looking for exposure on analyzing different asset classes (office/retail, hotel, warehouse, industrial, etc.) you will not find that here unless you are in the CDO primary servicing group.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to expand on protege' program, so that analysts and associates can eventually rotate through a 2-3 year program that includes primary and special servicing.

review.title: “Great experience!”
review.pros: Pros – Solid vision from the top guys and great execution so far. Fast paced and fast growing company that was a pleasure to work for. The majority of the people that work there are very smart and hard working, but know how to have a fun time as well.
review.cons: Cons – You could probably go to a more 'Wall Street' type firm and earn a bit more in salary, but you'll be giving up the work-life balance that C3 offers.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company
